videos.title: HOW TO MAKE A VOLCANO Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:
Looking for a fun and easy science project for kids?
Make this erupting volcano and amaze your friends!
Click here if you wish to become a patron of WhizKidScience http://patreon.com/whizkidscience

PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)

***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience

Free background music from JewelBeat.com
http://www.jewelbeat.com
Track Title "Fun With Friends"

How to Make Your Own Volcano
To make the dough:
3 cups flour
1 cup water
1 cup salt
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
Mix together and form a volcano shape
Alternatively you could use clay, paper mache, or even dirt!

To make the lava:
2 tablesoons of baking soda
an ounce of vinegar
a few drops of food colouring (optional)
Dish soap (optional)

Pour the baking soda, food colouring and dish soap into a small cup or into the opening of your volcano.
Add the vinegar and watch the reaction!

videos.title: BALLOON BLOW UP Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:
A fun and easy science experiment for kids of all ages!
Watch what happens when you mix vinegar with baking soda!

PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)

***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience

Free background music from JewelBeat.com
http://www.jewelbeat.com
Track Title "Fun with Friends"

Here's what you'll need:
A clear plastic bottle
Vinegar
2 tablespoons of baking soda
A large balloon
Funnel (s)

Fill your bottle halfway with vinegar.
Using a funnel, pour the baking soda into the balloon.
Fit the balloon over the mouth of the bottle and then lift the balloon up so that the baking soda falls into the bottle.
Watch as the balloon fills with the carbon dioxide that is produced when the baking soda reacts with the vinegar.

videos.title: TIE DYE MILK Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:
a fun and easy science experiment for kids of all ages using ingredients found in your home!

PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)
Free background music from JewelBeat.com
http://www.jewelbeat.com
Track Title "Fun With Friends"

Here's What You'll Need:
A shallow dish
Whole Milk or Half & Half Cream
Food Colouring
Dish Soap
Q-Tips

Pour some whole milk into the dish.  
Put a few drops of food colouring into the milk.
Dip one end of the Q-tip into the dish soap and then dip it into the milk.
Watch the tie-dye action!!!!

How it works:
The dish soap breaks the surface tension of the milk, sending the food colouring swirling!
The dish soap also works to break down fat in the milk (just like it works to break down grease on your dirty dishes).  During this process, the food colouring molecules are bumped and pushed around the dish.

videos.title: How to Make a LAVA LAMP Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:
A fun and easy science experiment for kids of all ages!  Make your own lava lamp using simple materials found in your home.
Click here if you wish to become a patron of WhizKidScience http://patreon.com/whizkidscience

***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience


Free background music from JewelBeat.com
http://www.jewelbeat.com
Track Title "Fun With Friends"

Here's what you'll need:
A clear bottle
Water
Vegetable Oil
Food Colouring
Alka Seltzer
A funnel (optional)

First fill your bottle 1/4 of the way full with water.
Next add vegetable oil using a funnel to fill the bottle.
Add some food colouring (watch as it sinks down into the water).
Finally add a few pieces of alka seltzer that have been broken up.
Voila - your very own lava lamp!!!

Try with different coloured food colouring and add more or less alka seltzer for varied effects.  You can even put a lid on your bottle for use another day!

How it works:
When you add alka seltzer, the carbon dioxide that is produced rises to the surface bringing water and food colouring along with it.  When the carbon dioxide is released at the top of the bottle, the water and food colouring sink back down because it is more dense than the oil.
tags: how to make a lava lamp

videos.title: LAVA IN A CUP Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:
Free background music from JewelBeat.com
http://www.jewelbeat.com/free/free-background-music.htm
Track Title "Fun With Friends"

Easy Kids Science Experiments - Lava in a Cup

What you will need:
Water
A clear glass or plastic cup
Food Colouring (Optional)
1/4 cup Vegetable Oil
1 tsp Salt

Fill a glass 3/4 full with water
Add 5 drops of food colouring
Add the vegetable oil
Add salt

How it works:
The salt brings the oil down with it as it sinks to the bottom of the bottle.  When it reaches the water, the salt dissolves and the oil is then free to float back to the top.

videos.title: HOW TO MAKE SLIME Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:
A fun and easy science experiment for kids of all ages!  Make your own SLIME!!!
Click here if you wish to become a patron of WhizKidScience http://patreon.com/whizkidscience
PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)
***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience


Here's what you'll need:
1 1/2 cups water
1 tsp borax
4 oz. glue (clear glue works best)
Food colouring (optional)
Glitter (optional)

Mix the borax into 1 cup of water
In a bowl, combine 1/2 cup water, the glue, 2 or 3 drops of food colouring, and glitter.  Stir well.

Add the borax mixture into your bowl and stir.  You will see the goo start to harden right away.  Mix with your hands and set aside for a couple of minutes to dry to a rubbery consistency.  You can discard the remaining water in the bowl.

Your goo will last for up to two weeks if kept in a tightly sealed bag.

videos.title: CHROMATOGRAPHY Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:
A fun and easy science experiment for kids of all ages!

PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)

***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience

Music by Dan-O at DanoSongs.com (Kira Fled the District)

CHROMATOGRAPHY is the separation of mixtures into their constituents by preferential adsorption by a solid, in this case as a strip of filter paper (paper chromatography).

Here's what you'll need for this experiment:
Coffee filter
popsicle stick
markers, felt tip pens, or food coloring
water
clear glass or dish
tape
scissors

- First cut your coffee filter into strips
- Tape your coffee filter onto a popsicle stick
- Colour a line near the bottom of your filter with marker, ink, or food coloring
- Place enough water in your glass so that just the bottom of the filter will touch the water
- Hang your filter over the water with your popsicle stick
- Watch the colours separate

videos.description:

Music by Dan-O at DanoSongs.com (Magic Ghost)
Easy Kids Science Experiments Six Layer Density Tower

Add the following to your glass in order.  Use a funnel or the back of a spoon to help you slowly pour in each layer.
1. Syrup (the most dense out of our 6 liquids)
2. Milk
3. Dish Soap
4. Water (colored with food coloring)
5. Vegetable Oil
6. Rubbing alcohol (colored with food coloring) (The least dense out of our 6 liquids)

videos.title: Easy Kids Science Experiments Microwave Ivory Soap
videos.description:
A fun and easy science experiment for kids of all ages!  See what happens when you put a bar of ivory soap in the microwave!

PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)

***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience

Music by Dan-O at DanoSongs.com (Starburst - Dreams)


You will need a fresh bar of Ivory soap.  It must be Ivory soap because it is one of the only soaps that have tiny air pockets inside.  Ivory soap will actually float when placed in water because of these pockets!

As the soap heats up in the microwave, steam is created and pushes outward making the soap expand.  This is a really fun and easy experiment to try with kids.

videos.title: HOW TO MAKE A BOUNCY BALL Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:
An easy kids science experiment demonstrating how to make your own bouncy ball!

PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)
***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience


Music by Dan-O at DanoSongs.com (Starburst - Dreams)
Make your own Bouncing Ball!

Here's what you'll need:
Borax Solution:
1/2 tsp Borax
2 tablespoons warm water
Food Colouring (optional)

In a small dish, add 1 tablespoon of school glue (clear or white)
Add a dash of glitter (optional)
add 1/2 tsp of the borax mixture
add 1 tablespoon of cornstarch
Stir rapidy until stiff
Mold it into a ball using your hands
Let sit for 5-10 minutes or until it is no longer sticky

Keep your bouncing balls in a ziploc bag.
tags: how to make a bouncing ball
how to make a bouncy ball

videos.title: Easy Kids Science Experiment Fireworks in a Jar
videos.description:
An fun and easy science experiment for kids of all ages!


PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)

***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience

Music by Dan-O at DanoSongs.com (The Living Physicist)
Fireworks in a Jar
(↓↓ click show more ↓↓)

Here's what you'll need:
A jar
Water
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
Food colouring

Fill you jar 3/4 full with warm water
Add 3-4 drops of each colour of food colouring to 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a small dish.
Gently mix to break the food colouring into smaller droplets
Pour the oil mixture slowly into your water.
The vegetable oil will sit on top of the water and the food colouring will slowly sink into the water creating bursts of colour.

videos.description:
A fun and easy science experiment for kids of all ages!  Make your own hovercraft using simple materials from your home!

PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)
How to Make Your Own Hovercraft
(↓↓ click show more ↓↓)

P.O. Box 103
94 Church st West
Delhi, Ontario 
N4B 1V0 CANADA

***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience


Music by Dan-O at DanoSongs.com (Living the Daydream)

Here's what you'll need:
A sports lid from a water bottle OR a lid from a bottle of dish soap
Small balloon
Tape
CD or DVD
Push Pin
Hot Glue Gun

Cover the hole in your CD or DVD with tape and punch 6 holes in it with the push pin.  Glue the lid onto the middle of the CD/DVD with hot glue.  Stretch out your balloon and blow it up keeping the air in by squeezing the neck of the balloon.  Make sure the lid is closed then carefully put the balloon opening over the lid so that the neck is as far down as possible.  Your balloon must be able to stand freely.  Open the lid and watch the CD/DVD hover on the pocket of air underneath.

videos.title: BEST Playdough recipe WITHOUT cream of tartar or cooking!
videos.description:
The easiest recipe for play-doh that is just like the real thing using ingredients already in your home!
Click here if you wish to become a patron of WhizKidScience http://patreon.com/whizkidscience
PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)
Easy Kids Crafts How to Make PLAY DOH PLAYDOUGH with koolaid NO COOKING
(↓↓ click show more ↓↓)

***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience


Here's what you'll need for each colour:

1/2 cup flour
1/4 cup warm water
1/4 cup salt
2 teaspoons vegetable oil
1 package Koolaid

First add 1/4 cup warm water to a mixing bowl.  Then add 1/2 package of Koolaid to the water and stir until dissolved.  For brighter colours, add the whole package of Koolaid.  Alternatively, add food colouring to the water.
Add 2 teaspoons of vegetable oil.
Add 1/4 cup salt
Add 1/2 cup flour

Mix together and then knead dough.  If you find your dough is sticky, add a little more flour.
Keep your playdough in a sealed container or ziploc bag.

This playdough is non toxic and edible.

Music by Dan-O at DanoSongs.com (Wait for the Dawn)

videos.title: EGG IN A BOTTLE Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:
Try this amazing and easy kids science experiment.  Watch as the egg gets sucked inside the bottle!

PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)
EGG IN A BOTTLE

***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience
***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience

HERE'S WHAT YOU'LL NEED
Hard Boiled Egg
Wide mouth bottle
Small strip of paper
A lighter or matches (please ask a parent to help you)

Peel your hard boiled egg.  Ask a parent to light the strip of paper and place it in the bottle.  Quickly place your egg on the top of the bottle.  Watch as the flame extinguishes and the egg is pushed inside the bottle.

Music by Dan-O at DanoSongs.com (Living the Daydream)

videos.title: Easy Kids Crafts - MAKE A SUNCATCHER Glow in the Dark
videos.description:
PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)
HOW TO MAKE A SUNCATCHER
(↓↓ click show more ↓↓)

HERE'S WHAT YOU'LL NEED
Barrel Pony Beads
Pie Plate
Muffin Tin
String

Preheat oven to 450 degrees
Place Beads in a single layer in the bottom of your pie plate and muffin tin.  Ask a parent to cook in oven for 15-20 minutes.  Keep a close eye on your melting beads so they don't burn.
Remove from oven and let stand for 5 minutes.  They cool and re-harden quickly.
Pop your suncatcher out of the tins and drill holes slowly so you can string your pieces together.

videos.title: HOW TO MAKE SILLY PUTTY WITHOUT BORAX
videos.description:
A fun and easy science experiment for kids of all ages!  Make your own silly putty without any borax!

PLEASE LIKE, COMMENT, & SUBSCRIBE  :)
***TWITTER***
https://twitter.com/WhizKidScience

***INSTAGRAM***
http://followgram.me/WhizKidScience


Music by Dano-Songs Wait for the dawn

HOW TO MAKE SILLY PUTTY
Pour two tablespoons of Elmer's White Glue into a dish
Add about 6 drops of food colouring (optional)
Stir with a Popsicle stick or spoon
Add one tablespoon of liquid starch
Stir - it will immediately start to react and harden
Let sit for half an hour.  The longer you let it sit, the more it will turn out like silly putty.
Store in a plastic bag or container.
tags: how to make slime without borax

videos.title: MAGIC MUD OOBLECK Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:

HOW TO MAKE OOBLECK!
Mix cornstarch and water in a 2 to 1 ratio.
I used 1 cup of water and 2 cups of cornstarch.  You can add more cornstarch or water to get the desired consistency.

You can add food colouring to the water before you mix it with the cornstarch if you want coloured Oobleck!

HAVE FUN!!!

HOW TO SHRINK A SUN CHIPS

videos.description:
Make your own sidewalk chalk using 3 simple ingredients.
Experiment with different moulds and colours!
SAFETY TIPS - Plaster of Paris powder is extremely light and fine, thus easily dispersed through air. Caution should be taken to avoid getting the powder to the eyes and nose. Wearing a dust mask is recommended.
- Never mix Plaster of Paris with your bare hands.
- Kids mixing Plaster of Paris need adult supervision.

videos.title: Newton's FLYING BEADS!  Easy Kids Science Experiments
videos.description:
Watch as Newton's Beads fly out of a cup as a result of INERTIA!

According to Isaac Newton, an object at rest stays at rest and an object in motion (like the beads) stays in motion with the same speed and in the same direction unless acted upon by an unbalanced force.

videos.title: DIY PINWHEEL Easy Kids Science
videos.description:
How to Make Your Own Pinwheel!
As the wind blows into the pockets of the pinwheel, it spins in a counterclockwise direction.  A pinwheel is similar to a wind turbine.  Wind turbines can change the energy in wind into electricity.

videos.title: Groovy Lab in a Box - We Made a Circuit!  STEM Activity Demonstration
videos.description:
We are so excited to share Groovy Lab in a Box with you!
Use our link https://groovylabs.page.link/u9DC to order your very own Groovy Lab in a Box.

Groovy Lab in a Box is full of everything a child needs to learn about and do hands on science, technology, engineering, and mathematics (STEM) experiments. 

HOW IT WORKS
Your subscription includes a monthly delivery of Groovy Lab in a Box science inquiries, engineering design challenges, and access to “Beyond…in a Box”– our members only web-based learning section on our website.  All subscription plans enjoy free shipping within the United States.
